DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Partial Response Or Better Status Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not there was a partial or better disease response.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Partial Response Or Better Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._At least 30 percent decrease in the sum of the longest diameter of measured lesions (target lesions) taking as reference the baseline sum of longest diameters._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._In an improved condition._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.:Or; used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:In an improved condition.:A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A decrease in the size of a tumor, or in the extent of cancer in the body, in response to treatment.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Unknown Not Done Not Applicable Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.:Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or completed.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

The non-affirmative response to a question.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
